class.name: I128
class.brief_description: A class representing a 128-bit signed integer.
class.description: The I128 class provides functionality to handle 128-bit signed integers, including conversion to and from various types such as integers, strings, and floats, as well as support for fixed-point arithmetic.

method.name: from_float
method.description: Creates an I128 instance from a float value with optional precision for fixed-point conversion.

method.name: from_int
method.description: Creates an I128 instance from an integer value.

method.name: from_string
method.description: Creates an I128 instance from a string representation (hexadecimal or decimal).

method.name: from_variant
method.description: Creates an I128 instance from a Variant.

method.name: to_calldata
method.description: Converts the 128-bit integer to a calldata-compatible format (PackedStringArray).

method.name: to_float
method.description: Converts the 128-bit integer to a float, optionally using the specified precision for fixed-point conversion.

method.name: to_string
method.description: Converts the 128-bit integer to its string representation.
